document_data.name: Windspell Street
document_data.mainbody: '''Windspell Street''' was a major street in the [[Baldur's Gate/Temples District|Temples District]] district of [[Baldur's Gate]] and the location of the [[High House of Wonders]] and the Ducal [[High Hall]].
document_data.Location: Windspell Street was a mostly straight street that stretched from the [[Citadel Gate]] and [[The Run (Baldur's Gate)|The Run]] and reaching the Old Wall in the southeast. There was at least one rooming house located on Windspell Street, west of [[the Wide]].
document_data.Notable Locations:
*[[Lionsmoot]], one of three major moots in Baldur's Gate, named after The House of the Lion festhall located on its eastern angle.{{cite web| url = https://web.archive.org/web/20220221195407/http://www.candlekeep.com/library/articles/sse/sse_1112-04.htm| title = So Saith Ed Nov â€“ Dec 2004| accessdate = 25-11-2021| date = 25-11-2021}}
*[[The House of the Lion]], an opulent festhall for "blades" and "lacethroats."
*[[Vanthampur Villa]], home of the [[Vanthampur]] family.
*[[Portyr Estate]], the estate of the [[Portyr]] family.
*[[Stelmane Estate]], home of the [[Stelmane]] family.
*[[High Hall]], the Ducal Palace and the seat of the [[Council of Four]].
*[[Helm and Cloak]], a high-end inn, rooming house, and festhall that was comprised of two buildings fronting Windspell Street just north of the High House of Wonders.
*[[Six Wise Machinists]], a statue on Windspell Street that was vandalized in [[1482 DR]].
